Reviews.Title: “Great value close to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Ev-n-jonny
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy hotel. Very close to metro and Zocolo. Clean new bathrooms, fan and tv in rooms. Decent restaurant and 24/7 wifi and computer use! Would stay here again anytime:)

Reviews.Title: “Execelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Efra85
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for several days and the experience was great. They are very helpful and flexible on any request. Very cheap prices and the location is amazing. Just two blocks from el zocalo, the national palace, half a block from el metro and walking distance to bellas artes. The rooms are very small but are comfortable. It doesn't have an AC and thus the room can get a lol hot but the fan helps a little. The rooms are clean and decorated in a simple yet very modern way. Truly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeacherOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: No frills! Tiny bath and a comfortable bed with a window you can open for air. For under $25 USD/night, this is a real steal. You're just a few blocks from the Zocalo, and even closer to the Zocalo's metro station which will zip you to the Zona Rosa or other parts of Mexico City. It's not noisy at all, and still very accessible by taxi (you're also just a few blocks away from a grocery store, department stores, and restaurants). Why overspend on your hotel? If you are travelling alone or with other budget-minded travellers, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Inspiracio
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable. I had read some bad opinions about noisy, but we didn't hear any noise in the room. The hotel is centrally situated.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap near Zocalo”
Reviews.Author: Seattle07
Reviews.Content: Very inexpensive. We paid only $25 per night. Rooms in the back are dark, on airwells, and unpleasant. But rooms in the front, facing the street are light, airy and very nice. The hotel is remodeling, so all rooms may improve in the future. Good location, two blocks from Zocalo. Good small restaurant on premises, free email in lobby. Said to be an unsafe area at night but didn't feel scary to this single woman. Staff very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and in budget”
Reviews.Author: cmartinezn
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located (2 block from Zocalo, 1 block from metro). The hotel is clean. Rooms are not luxurious, but they are fine for what you pay. Breakfast not included, but there's a cafeteria beside the hotel. The employees are kind. The only complaint refers to some noisy guests, but that's not the hotel fault.

HotelInfo.Name: Roble
HotelInfo.Address: Uruguay 109, Mexico City 06060, Mexico
